sections.name: Ancient Rivener
sections.text: Ikeshtis who eschew their society are exiled and quickly devolve into violent creatures known as riveners.

sources.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star

link.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86
link.alt: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86

sections.name: Ikeshti
Ikeshti Characteristics
sections.text: Ikeshtis are reptilian humanoids with a unique evolutionary lifestyle, from the petite ikeshti brood-minders who collectively raise their community's young and the congregants who manage the settlement to the hulking riveners whose tormented exile transforms them into near-mindless, violent juggernauts.

sources.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star

link.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86
link.alt: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86

sections.text: Ikeshtis are reptilian humanoids native to Akiton's wastelands. Smaller than Golarion's iruxi, ikeshtis organize around distinct societal roles.

sources.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star

link.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86
link.alt: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86

sources.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star

link.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86
link.alt: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86

traits.name: Chaotic
traits.text: Chaotic effects often manipulate energy from chaos-aligned Outer Planes and are anathema to lawful divine servants or divine servants of lawful deities. A creature with this trait is chaotic in alignment.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

sources.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star

link.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86
link.alt: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86

sources.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star

link.name: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86
link.alt: Pathfinder #173: Doorway to the Red Star pg. 86

modifiers.name: can speak and understand only simple words

interaction_abilities.name: Violent Instincts
interaction_abilities.text: An ancient rivener attacks the nearest creature when confused instead of any other effect, and ignores magical commands compelling them to do anything other than attack.

universal_monster_ability.name: Ferocity
universal_monster_ability.trigger: The monster is reduced to 0 HP.
universal_monster_ability.effect: The monster avoids being knocked out and remains at 1 HP, but its wounded value increases by 1. When it is wounded 3, it can no longer use this ability.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: This weapon can be used to attack enemies up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent enemies. For creatures with reach, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

ability.name: Slaughter Tackle
ability.text: The ancient rivener Leaps at a target within 30 feet, and then makes one jaws Strike and one claw Strike in any order.

ability.name: Squirt Blood
ability.effect: The ikeshti squirts blood from one of their eyes at a target within 30 feet. The target must attempt a DC 18 Fortitude save or become sickened 1 (sickened 2 on a critical failure).
